website_summaries.verdict: Powered by TV so you can use it anywhere. Can be controlled through the Roku app.
pros: Good WiFi connectivity with an HDMI port that provides extra options
Easy, fast setup and good selection of streaming stations
cons: Has to be physically attached to the TV

website_summaries.verdict: The Express delivers everything good about Roku for a rock-bottom price, but it's worth spending a bit extra on a faster streamer.
pros: The Roku Express is cheap, easy to use and loaded with streaming apps
cons: It's slower, especially with Netflix, than alternatives that cost just a few bucks more

website_summaries.verdict: The Express is Roku's least expensive media streamer yet, though its low price comes at the cost of performance. But for $30, it's pretty impressive.
pros: Lots of streaming media services and apps thanks to the Roku Channel Store
Private listening with the Roku app
cons: Infrared remote requires line of sight

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Streaming Stick
customer_reviews.text: What I love about it ... you can extend it down from a high TV with a long HDMI cord. What drives me nutty ... I have to tell it to turn on closed captioning EVERY TIME and for EVERY EPISODE on Hulu. I don't have that same issue on the AmazonFire, for example. This is inexpensive and totally does what I need it to do. Just not quite as gracefully as I'd hoped (you really have to have the remote pointed right at it!)
customer_reviews.author: Crunch

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion Roku streamers are the best on the market. I have the Roku express on 3 TV's. If your TV has a USB and HDMI port everything connects neat and tidy. The cables and power supply (if needed) are included
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this as a Christmas gift for my dad, It seems it has good reviews and I will update my review later when my dad tries it out, i have the Roku 3 and hope it is as good or better:) My dad doesn't socialize as much anymore, he's always watching things on YouTube, Hulu, Netflix and ordering movies on here. He absolutely loves it and I'm glad. I used it myself and it's pretty fast and the same as any other roku or product of it's kind, especially with the cheaper price, you can't beat it!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ashliee

customer_reviews.title: Poor replacement of Roku 2
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement to an ageing Roku2. Bad choice. The Roku Express is not a quality product. It doesn't not respond to the controller, constantly lags / buffers and requires frequent restarts after becoming unresponsive. This is not an issue with my Internet or Wifi as this box sits 10 feet from by router and streaming from any other device does not suffer from the same quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good until recently
customer_reviews.text: My ROKU Express is now over 2 years old and worked great until a few months ago when I started to get an issue with video and audio going out of sync. I have a simple setup with the ROKU Express plugged into an Elements TV via HDMI and there are no additional sound devices connected. I see many posts on this same issue on the ROKU community support page and some suggest this is a ROKU software issue introduced during a recent upgrade. I loved my ROKU and I would have given it 5 stars but this video/audio sync problem is very annoying and makes me want to try a different solution.
customer_reviews.author: DenM

customer_reviews.title: Updated: disappointed with Roku.
customer_reviews.text: I had Apple TV prior to this, and I didn't like that you couldn't download various apps. I also didn't like that the remote could be lost so easily. I like the Roku a little better. Still adjusting to some random things, but overall better (and cheaper) than Apple TV. Update: Yeah the Roku is a piece of junk. It started with netflix closing every time I started a show, and now multiple apps do not work. Google “Netflix shuts down on Roku.” This is a common problem. I wish I could send back the Roku, but all this nonsense started after the 30 day window.
customer_reviews.author: AmyEliz

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service for a useless product
customer_reviews.text: After only four months of light use this Roku is unwatchable because of the constant flickering. There is absolutely no customer service available at Roku so don't expect any help fixing any technical issues. What a waste of money. I've replaced the cables, reset it a million times, nothing fixes this issue. If you go to the roku forums you'll see this is a very common complaint with zero resolution from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Mghirardi

customer_reviews.title: Works great ... when the hotel allows it
customer_reviews.text: It works great...where it works. BUT: I purchased it specifically for travel and hotel stays. In five different hotel rooms, I was only able to get a successful connection and stream in one. Some hotels really would prefer you didn't hit their bandwidth with your own individual streaming device, and they make it very difficult to hook up. One place I tried was especially frustrating: they had blocked input switching on the in-room screen and replaced the remote with one that had no input switching button. We have used RoKu at home for several years, and love the simplicity and integration of our different streaming sources. It's frustrating that such considerations are considered "competition" by some hotels.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. MccaffreyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Jesus.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect device if you have kids who want "tv" in their room but you don't want to pay for cable. Super easy access to Netflix and Hulu. It's like the cheapest streaming stick on here and it's also IMO one of the best(next to fire tv stick).
customer_reviews.author: Regina Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love the Roku
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love the Roku! Small, easy to install, so many channels! I have a Samsung DVD and I thought it had a lot of apps, but Roku has a zillion more--something for literally everyone. I've only had it about a week and I keep finding out more things about it. You can use it as soon as you set it up, but expect a learning curve after that because there's more to it than you think
customer_reviews.author: Y. Buonamici

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 1/2 weeks, NO MORE PHONE TECH SUPPORT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working, out of the blue, after 2 1/2 weeks!!! This morning I turned it on and all I got was a flashing color bars screen. Called tech support and apparently customers are "not eligible to get support from a telephone agent." WHAT?????? They no longer have phone tech support??!!!! Sent me to the tech support website where I couldn't find anything along of the lines of solving my problem or even finding this kind of issue. I'm giving up and returning this. Thank goodness it happened fast enough so that I COULD still return it. I love Roku, but them getting rid of phone tech support is the stupidest idea EVER!!! No longer a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great even with average wifi speed.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am impressed as we do not get very good wifi upstairs but this runs smooth in 720p. Using Amazon prime shows/movies right now, will try netflix when we get bored. Easy install..plug in and it will update..make an account on your phone or computer and it does ask for a CC number I guess for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: The future is here.
customer_reviews.text: The future of streaming is here. Forget cable tv. Get the cheapest internet only you can find. Subscribe to Slingtv and get a free roku to get 150 channels of regular stuff. Then subscribe to your favorite movie apps or whatever (netflix, amazon prime, hulu, etc,). Share services by using plans that allow up to 4 devices, friends, or family. We're doing it for about $60 total each month per family. Sideclick is also a nice add on as a universal remote to attach to your roku. You will need an extra roku for each tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not 5G compatible for WIFI. this is a 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: not 5G compatible for WIFI. this is a 2.4 G technology. You will get internet disruption if you have less than 30 Megabites of data per second with Government communications at 5G jamming the airwaves with this 2G that works only with a 2G signal from a wireless router. This unit will not see a 5G signal from a 5G wireless router. Ripoff investment if you live in the city. The internet providers are hooking us to more expensive data speeds to facilitate this weak in technology gadget. Roku should stop selling this. They afford the cable companies to make us buy higher speed data
customer_reviews.author: Albie Llada

customer_reviews.title: Great player for a fraction of cost.
customer_reviews.text: Great player. I was able to watch some Live TV without any dropouts. Picture quality is great for HD channels. Startup time is reasonable. Channel loading time is also acceptable. Menu scrolling does slowdown at times. But after a restart it is back to normal speed. For the price, the accessories included is great value. I was surprised to see that the "Search" option is not available in this device. Roku website Help shows feature availability in Roku devices but it does not even mention about the lack of the feature in Roku Express. Searching a channel is like searching for a needle in a hay stack. It will miss one star for taking out this useful feature.
customer_reviews.author: Joel John

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly with Amazon Prime Video App
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use when I wasn't connected to cable. I have not had to use it until now because of the pandemic. I have many apps on my roku. It works fine with tv stations, movie apps, and paid services. The ONLY APP it does not work with is Amazon Prime. When I watch a movie it glitches constantly. The voice is out of sync with the dialogue. I keep refreshing but the problem continues. I have called Amazon four times about this. I have been walked through EVERY trouble fixing issue, including resetting the Roku back to its original factory settings. It is just not compatible with Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set-up and so many channels
customer_reviews.text: Got this to deal with my BLU-Ray and it's being cranky with streaming. It was not wanting to load Prime Video and some other things to stream although everything was fine and it had no updates . This has a wonderful selection of pre-loaded channels and ones you can add (some naturally are subscriptions others free). Wishing I got this earlier. Set-up was an absolute breeze. Mine is connected to the TV via the USB for power. I didn't realize I had a USB port until i got curious and looked what kind of connection was under the service port. Was fully expecting to have to plug it in to an outlet. Will definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Happy fiber

customer_reviews.title: I have had this roku for 1 year and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this roku for 1 year and it is now unusable because it will not connect to the internet. It is not a problem with my internet because none of my other devices are having issues connecting, and I have the roku right next to my router. I attempted all of the trouble shooting listed on the roku website and it is still not working. I also attempted to call customer service for roku but they said that agent support is not available for the roku express. I will not be purchasing another roku, I will be taking my business to another streaming device service.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Say "no" to Smart TVs and say "yes" to Roku
customer_reviews.text: I have a Samsung "smart tv" however the apps almost never work. My wifi signal is strong but streaming still buffers which seriously affects movie and tv show watching experience and the apps crash all the time. Now, I'm seeing notices that certain apps will no longer be supported on the device. WTH! Well, thank goodness we have external devices like the Roku. It's cheaper than opting for an "upgraded" "smart tv" and extremely easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: liz7435

customer_reviews.title: First one worked really well so bought this one for a second TV.
customer_reviews.text: This is our Second Roku device as we needed it on another TV. I was expecting some issues trying to get the second one to sync up to my Roku/Netscape/Amazon/CBS accounts but it went pretty well with minimal problems. The original ROKU just plugged into the HDMI port on the TV and worked well, I was not sure about this newer one that uses a cable between the ROKU unit and TV. I ended up just stuffing it all behind the TV between the TV and wall. I think having the option of doing a direct connect would be nice but hay, this seems to work OK even though it is not as elegant in how it is hooked up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Rapid City

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roku!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't missed cable since purchasing the roku. I wasn't sure how I would like it since the express is said to have slower speed/load times but I haven't noticed any delays at all. I know sometimes you get what you pay for but it's not the case in Roku Express and definitely worth getting the cheaper version! I even bought 2 more for my other tv's.
customer_reviews.author: KCR_313

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy, I have a older LED Tv that does not have a build in Wifi adapter so I been using my blue ray player to stream movie and such but it also lag and slow loading I keep blaming my router is too far away until I install this gadget and all of a sudden it load as fast as my brand new 4 k TV. It is easy to install and simple remote control set up.And the remote it come with is great and simple ,I hate remote that have like 500 buttons and need 4 years of college to know how to work it. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pikachu

customer_reviews.title: Good low-cost way to add streaming content to dumb TVs
customer_reviews.text: Great, inexpensive way to add various on-line content services to a dumb TV. Runs amazingly fast, faster than our fairly new smart TV in fact which was surprising. Seems pretty robust too, I've only had to reboot it once in twice in many months of near-continual use. Initial set-up, connection to wi-fi, and logging in to your various streaming services is a bit tedious with the basic remote, but once it's set up it remembers the settings & passwords even through re-boots and power cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bonner

customer_reviews.title: It is a great an easy to use product and allows me to ...
customer_reviews.text: With a simple remote I can manage most of my TV viewing channels. It is a great an easy to use product and allows me to watch many content that was previously available online for computers. There is only one thing, when you turn the unit on the colors show all messed up, what I do is unplug the HDMI cable and reconnect it right back, this restore the colors to the normal range. I know that I could have sent it back when I bought it so I don't have to bother; but I am from the time that there were only 3 tv channels and one remote channel changer ME!
customer_reviews.author: AWOL

customer_reviews.title: it's Roku's fault for not making the movie available in continue watching or somewhere easy to find
customer_reviews.text: Extremely dissatisfied! Bulry most of the time, if you push the wrong button in the dark it's your fault. If you push the wrong button in the dark and cannot find the movie again just to continue watching it, it's Roku's fault for not making the movie available in continue watching or somewhere easy to find! Come on Roku, how hard is it for you to make your system work better for folks that make a simple mistake? Roku does everything so great except this! In the dark i press the wrong button and can never continue watching the movie without spending 10 or 20 minutes looking for it? I know you guy's can do better than that!
customer_reviews.author: milbrook

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile then gave up connecting
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 8 months. i have two other Roku devices (3&4). This Express will no longer pair with remote. It is not the remote as I can easily pair the remote that came with the Express with the 4 device. When I tried to get help from Roku there is no number to call and it indicates online that I am not eligible for support of any kind. Roku has set a new standard for poor support. If you don't buy their top of the line product they wash their hands of you. No consideration that I own two other Roku products.
customer_reviews.author: mike_wood

customer_reviews.title: Saving Streamers!!!
customer_reviews.text: We've had these about 6 months now, bought for our kids rooms since we have a smart tv in the living room. Absolutely best decision we have made in our stance against buying into the cable industry again directly. There's all of the options for kids TV that you'll want or they'll want, you can control what they watch, they cannot purchase without the pin that you set up on additional apps that aren't included. We already have Netflix so it's a plus for us! There's been no technical issues or malfunctions. Smooth sailing and if you're like our kids and lose remotes, no problem-- easy remote set up right on your mobile devices.
customer_reviews.author: JahEarth1003

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Easy to Use/Install
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Roku is a lovely one-stop streaming shop. It is so easy, that my 2-year-old son can use it to order all sorts of kiddie shows. The install takes approximately ten minutes or so. Roku operates off of your wifi. It comes with a handy USB to HDMI cable. I lost the charger, however, Roku USB power can be plugged in even with an Apple Charger or another charger which operates off of USB. We have sent several of these to our friends we like it so much.
customer_reviews.author: JM Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good, but next time I'll get a different version (my fault)
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Hindsight I'd really rather have one you don't have to point the remote at. I chose this version not know I'd care. (It's listed in the description so I knew before I bought it) but where I placed it on my tv wasn't in the best place, so I might try moving it but now I'll have to get a new command tape for it since there was no back up for silly people like me who place it somewhere bad. Lol oops my fault!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime M.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Super easy installation. This is my first time buying this type of device (streaming). I have nothing to compare it too other than to say that it eliminated the need to have another box rented from my cable company (Xfinity). I use the Roku in my bedroom and have only one cable box from my cable provider. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: azalak696

customer_reviews.title: Do not expect it to perform like a more expensive streamer (i
customer_reviews.text: A lot of value for the price. It works exactly as advertised. Do not expect it to perform like a more expensive streamer (i.e. menu traversal is a little sluggish), but its media playback is very good for $30. I purchased two and couldn't be happier with it. It should be noted that the remote is infrared technology. I'm fine with this since the battery life on infrared remotes are usually longer than bluetooth, and there is an easy to use droid and windows app if you prefer to use your mobile device as a controller.
customer_reviews.author: mchessher

customer_reviews.title: Save on the Monthly Cable Box Rental if you are a Spectrum subscriber!
customer_reviews.text: We have Spectrum TV and Internet. Bought this specifically to use in place of a cable box from Spectrum. Easy to hook up, just make sure you place the little receiver in clear view of where you can point the remote. Quite a few apps available as long as you are a subscriber. We utilize it for Spectrum, Hulu, Amazon, Netflix, ESPN, BigTenNetwork, etc. Since we won't have to pay a monthly rental fee for another box through Spectrum....this will pay for itself if a few months!
customer_reviews.author: IG

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming device
customer_reviews.text: This Roku is great. It works perfectly and is very portable. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is because I'm coming from the Roku 3 which I still use as my room. I knew the Roku 3 would be a lot faster because it's more expensive, has better specifications, and has no wait time or button lag but the load time for apps and shows is ~10 seconds faster. That's fine especially considering the price difference; it just takes some adjusting when going from the speed and snappiness of the 3
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great product, USB power too low
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I can't say I love it is because within the first 3 times of use the Roku pops up with a message that the USB cable plugged into my tv can't supply enough power to the Roku. Well, it's the Roku brand name adapter and cable that comes with the unit, so now what? Roku actually replaced the wall adapter power supply with a new one and it seems to be fine now. Not sure what's wrong with the old one. But other than that it's great. Got it for Netflix for the kids room.
customer_reviews.author: NCBirdman

customer_reviews.title: Buy the 2017 model, not 2016. The 2017 model let you cast youtube, the 2016 does not. This is a major feature for me!
customer_reviews.text: I really like Roku, but if I would give you a suggestion, don't buy the 2016 model . Buy the Roku express 2017. The 2016 model do not let you cast youtube video, which is a major feature in my opinion. This is fixed in the 2017 expression. I would like to make a comparison of Roku and Chromecast. I would say I prefer Roku! Chromecast has the advantage of easily cast your current chrome tab, videos. However, Roku gives you easy access to mulitple channels, let you set up netflix, hbo now, amazon prime and whatever channel you want. It also makes it easy to search for movies and provide some interesting recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Ieumes

customer_reviews.title: The Streaming Player I Was Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the Amazon reviews for RoKu Express, I was convinced that this was the product I had been looking for. We had been using the Netflicks mail order movies for years. Why we didn't change to streaming video sooner I'll never know. Well, hope I can help spread the word about how great it is: easy to install, has its' own remote and access to other programs besides Netflicks. As I was researching streaming video players, I asked a few of my younger friends about Roku. None of them had heard of Roku. So I did my part and educated them. Good luck with this product! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: CoHiLa Girl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but....
customer_reviews.text: I like this roku, so handy when Im watching tv in my room and i don't have cable. There are a couple channels that stream free videos which is good especially for a college student like me who can't afford to buy a lot of video streaming apps. The only thing i don't like about this is when i search a video or type in usernames and passwords it takes so long because you will have to use the directional buttons. I tried downloading the roku app and using the keyboard and it doesn't work. But overall this roku is great :)
customer_reviews.author: Mary Noniscan

customer_reviews.title: My first
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Roku Express. This is my first media streamer ever. And I'm very happy with it. It has my cable provider tv and my Amazon video. Very nice deal and so easy to use!!! There is one drawback with the Roku Express and that is that it doesn't support miracast from my Android phone to my television. If your looking for a device which supports this feature Roku does have a different media streamer device for that.
customer_reviews.author: MsDawn

customer_reviews.title: our 3 Roku - replace last because of price and supposedly faster and works with Phone App!
customer_reviews.text: our 3 Roku - replace last because of price and supposedly faster - which we think it is strangely the remote is simply IR and not RF - but you can use it with the Roku app on your smart phone / table and then the unit does use Bluetooth to receive from your phone. We enjoy using the app on our phone- better faster searching - don't have to put up wit Netflix trying to play a trailer of everything your are looking at (what's that poop about?) then when you find what you want in whatever channel you are working with its playing on Roku already ...
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: I'm thrilled with it
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this thing for about two weeks, and have already gotten my money's worth. I mainly just want to watch Netflix, YouTube, all my Amazon Prime stuff, and also be able to access my HBO GO account, and it does all of that. The UI may be a bit stripped down for some, but I think I actually prefer it over the Fire Stick I have on another TV - that may be something you'd want to consider. Given that I paid 25 bucks for this, I'm absolutely thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Just_Keith

customer_reviews.title: Smart Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The smartest purchase I've made in a while. 100s of free channels are included. I almost skipped buying a streaming package, but did go ahead and get DirecTv Now to get ESPN... It is easy to work, but if I had to do it over again, knowing what I now know, I would buy the voice activated one. Why? The "guide" is easy on the eyes and well organized, but there is no way to use the remote to just jump from, say, ABC to TBS. We have to stream through the alphabet. If it were voice activated, I could just tell it to turn to TBS.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda H

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I️ had one of these before with no problems a couple years ago and we loved it. I️ moved and bought a new one and it worked for two weeks then stopped working entirely. Tried customer service. They blamed my connection and we did all the steps and it still wouldn’t work. After I️ said I️ was just going to return it they then offered to replace it under warranty. I️ asked for a guarantee that it will work and they couldn’t so I’m just getting my refund from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cdog

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get this to work. After troubleshooting on third party websites (roku faq was unhelpful) I concluded that this stick Does not reach from my wireless router in office to tv in living room - approximately 45 feet. Wish I knew I had to buy a wireless signal booster, because I wasn’t planning to spend for any additional accessories to make this work. Anyway hope my uncle who gets the family tech hand me downs will love his new roku stick.
customer_reviews.author: ssstephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great item, affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: Cool item at an affordable price. I already own a fire stick but there are apps such as Vudu which are not and will not be made for fire stick. It's the only reason I bought the Roku Express. I actually find I like the interface better on the Roku. Much cleaner, more simple to use. Loads faster then the fire stick. Both are good but Roku offers more apps. It's because companies like Vudu see them as the competition so they won't produce an app for fire stick. It's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: IndyTazz

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE LOVE IT!!! OMGosh! The picture quality is better than regular TV. Signed up for Amazon Prime when I previously ordered a battery for my Dell laptop. OMGosh again! For $10.99/month, first month Prime was free. With my new Roku Express been catching up on True Blood (missed the last 2-3 seasons), scoped out all the horror movies I want to watch and TV shows that are for FREE with Prime. Amazon got it going on, baby!!!!! My sister tried to tell me and I didn't listen. Well, got it now. Never again will I say "There's nothing on TV." Now there's PLENTY! Love my Roku Express. YAAAAY! (doing my happy dance with pom-poms).
customer_reviews.author: ScribeNook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 5X stronger streaming device, including  cables, easy to follow instructions, setup, Affordabel! NO more commercials!!
customer_reviews.text: ROKU streaming device. This particular device is 5 X more powerful than Roku built before. Affordable price, all cables included easy setup, clear easy instructions with pictures. & excellent in service. A terrific streaming device, Netflix*, Hulu*, Amazon, Amazon Prime*, ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX News channels. Movies on Netflix*, You/tube*, Roku, Hulu*, CBS All Access*, Showtime*, HBO* add-on subscription (monthly fee).... many, many more. No more commercials, wouldn't that be nice. Enjoy TV shows uninterrupted by commercials, movies, so much more .
customer_reviews.author: Sunny 1

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first. But this product has been wonderful! Pros: easy to use, easy to set up, no subscription for roku (only for individual services like netflix, etc), offers streaming for things we'd never heard of, educational like Smithsonian channels and ted talks, and entertainment like buzzfeed video. Simply wow. Cons: MUST have the remote or the app on your phone. No way to change screens/channels without. Comes with power cord (micro USB like a phone charger and wall block) and short HDMI cable, and a double sided sticky thing to mount it to the side/top/bottom of the screen. Very impressed and totally worth the $29,99 cost.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Remote delays/issues
customer_reviews.text: Significant delays from pressing the remote buttons to the player reacting. I don't like the smaller remote (also have a Roku 3 from 7 years ago) as it's easier to lose and there is no headphone jack (I knew this buying this model, but it's still very disappointing). The remote also has to be almost directly pointed at the receiver for it to work instead of just the general direction as the older Roku models. If I buy another Roku, it will not be this model.
customer_reviews.author: Scout Finch

customer_reviews.title: A few things about Roku Express.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Roku. Comparing to Roku 3 and Ultra, it is much smaller. Easier to transport but you can't use it any hotel - most TVs in hotel rooms don't have USB port and WiFi is rarely fast enough. It is much slower than more expensive versions, it doesn't have a dual-core processor, applications get open slowly, and sometimes screen gets frozen for a couple of seconds. The other disadvantage is a remote controller, you have to point it at the device (you can point anywhere in other models). On the bright side, iPhone app is the same and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Elman

customer_reviews.title: Happy Roku Express owner...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased an Amazon Fire Stick but my kitten stole the remote and after a week I thought I would never find it (along with a pair of reading glasses and more). I decided to check the reviews about Roku Express despite a friend telling me he didn't think it would work as well as the regular Roku. To my surprise, I had the Roku express set up in minutes and the only tedious part was putting in all my passwords. I love the menu - very easy to navigate and the streaming is great. Very pleased with my purchase and thank you to everyone who gave very honest and detailed reviews.
customer_reviews.author: I. S. Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful Roku In A Tiny Footprint
customer_reviews.text: This Roku Express is way better than the streaming stick I have on another TV. It boots up as soon as the TV goes on (which the streaming stick doesn't) and will shut off when the TV goes off. It can be powered off the TV with the supplied USB cable, or you can plug it into the wall. I use the USB cable and have not had an issue with it losing power. Overall, I would recommend the Express over the Streaming Stick any day. Great investment for a tiny price.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Malinski

customer_reviews.title: ... so far a couple months in it has been great. I've cut off cable and gone to roku ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this Roku for my bedroom TV and so far a couple months in it has been great. I've cut off cable and gone to roku for all TV watching. There are a million apps some you have to pay subscription fees to and some you don't. The Roku is a one time charge for the equipment then you download what ever apps you want. Even with the couple of paid subscription apps Hulu and Netflix this has been way cheaper alternative to cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: To continue using ROKU we had to buy this new model.
customer_reviews.text: Because ROKU "upgraded" its system, we had to buy this new version to replace our original one. This has a much smaller receiver box and a handy glueless mounting strip to affix it to the TV, but for us it kept coming unstuck and falling off. After several attempts we finally got it to behave. We are not happy with the new system from ROKU which plays trailers and/or intros for selections instead of just letting us scroll quietly to the item we really want to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Elder Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best TV Money Spent To Date
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the money I've spent for television viewing since I became an adult, this is the best ever! We cancelled our cable, and watch nothing except streaming from our Roku! While there are subscription channels, there is so much free viewing that we haven't even begun to watch enough to entice us to pay for channels. At least not yet! I absolutely love the Roku! And I highly recommend it to anyone who want s to cut the cable bill!
customer_reviews.author: texicanwife

customer_reviews.title: ... LT model from a few years ago and much better. Seems faster
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a LT model from a few years ago and much better. Seems faster, and less buffering on one particular channel/show that always buffered. Satisfied with it. Only reason for 4 stars is it doesn't seem unreasonable that Roku figure out a way to maintain signin info on your channels. Spelling out old p/w's and emails in order to activate your already established channels is something that it would seem Roku could store in some way. Minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Better then I would have ever expected
customer_reviews.text: I have a fire stick but originally purchased a Roku Express because it was so cheap for black Friday. Loved it so much that I came to Amazon to buy another one. First I already had Spectrum cable on 1 TV in the house because additional boxes cost $10.00 a month well the Ruku allows me to access my spectrum via app., no buffing , switch back and forth easily now all of our TV's has cable and movie channels.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz.B.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to setup and use. As a Chromecast user, I'm really loving the very responsive remote control. Every week or so, however, one of my installed channels will simply disappear from my home screen. The only way to retrieve it is to remove the channel and then added it back again. I'm sure a future firmware update will fix this, but for now it's somewhat annoying. Otherwise, it works as designed and good quality playback thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Crappy
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Roku Express. With both devices I had the problem of it turning itself off 3 - 4 times a day. It would only come back on if I turned the tv off and left it off for about 5 minutes. I would not recommend this product. I gave it 2 stars because when it works it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Have had rokus for years and they always work well. Easy to install. Only issue is that it tells me I have some error which upon Google search said it's a setting. Checked and it's not set up so further searching and found out I needed to change the hdmi cable. Comes up about once every 3 or 4 months and it won't let me use the cables the error came up on. So bought a cheap 3.pack and ready whenever it happens just a waste of money wish they would fix that issue which is why 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: EllieA

customer_reviews.title: Device Bricked after a Week. No support provided.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a week and then bricked when I tried to install Amazon Video. It completed the download and then before loading the screen went blank. Now my TVs say "No Signal" whenever it is plugged in an powered, regardless of the HDMI port I use, or which TV (I've now tried multiple TVs without it working). Worst thing, Roku explicitly "does not provide agent-assisted support for this issue and product", with add provides no suggestion on how to reset a bricked device. It doesn't even function as an effective paperweight being so light.
customer_reviews.author: John Dermody

customer_reviews.title: Fast...beyond expectations
customer_reviews.text: Skeptical at first, but then I realized this has essentially the same processor and speed as the original Roku 3, which I've had for years. Got this as our 4th Roku and absolutely love it! Plugged in to the tv USB for power and hdmi for video, attached to the top of the tv via adhesive strips (included). Very pleased with everything about this. Have never had issues with speed or remote. Have not received the "buffering". Performance is above expectations.
customer_reviews.author: JediSteve

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: I got this remote for my mom. Originally it was great- the buttons were big enough for her to see, the remote was easy to use and install, and worked just as well as an Amazon fire stick. Unfortunately, it broke after about a year. I knew that this was cheaper than a firestick, so I didn’t expect firestick quality, but still, this shouldn’t be breaking after only a year. Really disappointed. Now I need to find a replacement for her, but I don’t think I’ll be going back to a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Saves a bunch of money
customer_reviews.text: I'm saving $75/month on my cable bill because I replaced four TV's with Roku's. It is a bit of a pain in the butt because you can't see the program while you look at the channel guide if you use Comcast ( Time warner seems to have better programming, so that is not an issue). And you loose the channel and have to reprogram on a regular basis. But in between, it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Elaina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: We lost the remote so it's a good thing we had already downloaded the app onto our phones to use as remotes. We are a non-technologically-oriented, older couple and this is easy to set up and use. Great to have local TV news again (free NewsOn app) and have Netflix and You Tube on the large TV screen. Best $35 we've spent in awhile on anything. Google the best free apps and enjoy. We have avoided getting an expensive, unwieldy antenna and have all the TV entertainment and news we need.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: The Roku is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I haven't come close to checking out all the channels because there is so much. The Roku is easy to use. I don't use the sticky tape strip to attach it to the TV. I just put it in a corner of the tv stand and it picks up everything with no problem. If it moves. I just put it back.I just have to make sure to put the remote in the caddy I have because it's easy to misplace, it's so small.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Roku Express
customer_reviews.text: With absolutely no notice from HULU, my iPad will no longer on my TV via cable to the HDMI port. I called HULU and they told me they no longer support it. I asked her what I was supposed to do and she said to try either Firestick or Roku. I got Roku, the cheapest option and this thing is AMAZING! It comes up on the screen, searches and finds my wifi, takes to a HULU screen and sets me up with all my saved shows intact. I can't believe it was so easy. And now, instead of cable hook ups, I just use a remote. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: SuzDuJour

customer_reviews.title: New Low in Customer "Service"
customer_reviews.text: Worst customer service ever - Roku does its best to make it impossible to contact them - in fact, after saying I wanted support for the Roku Express (brand new), was proudly informed it wasn't eligible for support. Chased around their phone "support", found no way to get connected to a person. After a great deal of searching, did turn up an email form. God knows if they'll bother to answer. Would not have purchased if I knew how awful their customer disservice was - they make United Airlines look good. Problem was in final step - setting up an account for payment. All else went OK. Three attempts at setting up an account have failed. Avoid
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Quick, fast, solid and very responsive. NETFLIX loads super-fast, as do most of the other channels. I also don't get a lot of buffering and pixelation, and I get those even on the computer sites direct, so this is a very welcome device. Worth every penny. I love the tons of channel options, although some of the bargain basement ones are annoying in that they play an ad between every music video, for example, and it's usually the two same ones! But the premium, name brand channles are great.
customer_reviews.author: John Palisano

customer_reviews.title: Total junk. Didn't even last a year before it just died. ROKU "support" non-existant
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk. Waste of money. Bricked itself in under a year. Roku offers ZERO, as in nothing, in terms of any support. Just TRY to find a phone number or email to get help. Only help is via worthless forums or scam 3rd party outfits that Roku redirects you to. Hope they finally go out of business.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeyfarmer

customer_reviews.title: It's not working although other devices in our home are running fine, including another TV with another Roku
customer_reviews.text: We have an older TV and ordered an adapter in order to be able to use the Roku on it. It's not working although other devices in our home are running fine, including another TV with another Roku. We're getting all zeros for the Mac and no others are coming up, ie neighbor's etc. My daughter tried to get the support number and it says our Roku doesn't qualify for support. Hoping to get this resolved. I'll update later, but so far the darn thing does not work...and rebooting our router doesn't do a thing.
customer_reviews.author: homebirthsaves

customer_reviews.title: Used to access Spectrum Cable TV
customer_reviews.text: This device gave me what I wanted - access to Spectrum Cable TV. And at half the cost I compared at regular retail. The only thing I might have considered differently was getting a remote with direct numerical channel look up. With this device you either have to do a "search" to find some specific channels, or you have to "scroll" up or down. And when you're watching channel #4, and want to go to #104 that's a lot of scrolling. But for the limited amount of time I use the TV this is hooked up to, it works just great.
customer_reviews.author: RidgeviewSales

customer_reviews.title: No agent/chat support for this model.
customer_reviews.text: While it seemed a good choice for my spare tv, I found that it doesn't stream Netflix after doing so for exactly 3 uses. I went to their support page. Nothing matched my problem. Contact Roku? No agent support for this model. Very unhappy. Could probably be resolved with a simple chat.
customer_reviews.author: GinnieBee

customer_reviews.title: Have three of them- Roku is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Our family is a big fan of the Roku interface. Very well thought out, simple enough for a 5 year-old and elegant from a design standpoint. We have three that are similar (but different), and it seems like they just get better over time. I have the Amazon Fire Stick on one of our TVs and I like it as well, but the remote and user interface is a hands-down winner if you have kids. You really couldn't go wrong either way as far as I'm concerned, but it's really hard not to love Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Apple HDMI and it was so inconvenient to use with the cables and everything else. I bought this Roku to conveniently connect my TV to Amazon Prime Video and Netflix. It was very easy to install and works like magic. I’m impressed! I do wish the remote control was bigger, have more button options and a back light option. I also didn’t like that they asked for payment details - although they did mention that they won’t charge unless you purchase shows from HBO, etc. Still left me uncomfortable, but luckily they had Paypal as a payment option. 4 stars over all.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Best price around and very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother-in-law that has the very first generation Roku and seriously needed an upgrade. Her old Roku was such a dinosaur that you could only get 4 channels on that thing and searching was fruitless. Install and registration was a breeze, just plugged into her HDMI and now she can watch her Netflix, Youtube and all the other channels she watches much easier. This is better priced and more user friendly than other devices like it.
customer_reviews.author: kcviper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and functional way to get Smart TV Features
customer_reviews.text: Ok to get smart TV features. I purchased 3 of these for various TVs around the house when we cut the cable for TV. They work well, easy to install and set up and to connect to home WiFi. The one that is used the most will on occasion 'lock up' and will not function. The only resolution is to unplug the AC power adapter, wait a few seconds and plug back in. It only takes a min to reconnect. Simple straight forward product.
customer_reviews.author: gamecock88

customer_reviews.title: A must for streaming
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my roku and bought another one it’s that great. It streams everything you can stream. I use it myself primarily to stream my digital video library from google play and it does it well and never lags. If roku can’t stream what you want nothing will. It makes any tv into a smart tv but actually has more apps than most smart TVs. A must buy
customer_reviews.author: Round Pooh Bear

customer_reviews.title: Best all around roku
customer_reviews.text: I have a roku 3 and like it. Bought a 4 which would not work properly, so finally bought the express. It is every bit as good as the roku 3. Only thing I don't like is line of sight, but the portability is a big plus! I have a 4K tv but the clarity is great! This does not have the problem of slow loading I experienced on the roku 4 and even on another roku 3 which I ended up returning. The 3 has a voice search remote which is a nice feature but it freezes at times so not really all that nice! No negatives with this one.
customer_reviews.author: texellence

customer_reviews.title: Roku just "Got it right" with the Express.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to set up a TV for an "extended stay" guest. This new Roku Express was released on the same day. Got it with the usual Amazon service and was very pleased with the new Roku's size, ease of setup and convenience of installation. My guest was watching her channels in just a few minutes and was able to operate the Roku Express remote almost immediatly. Good job, ROKU!
customer_reviews.author: Clyde O. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Works great, awesome price
customer_reviews.text: I have the Roku 3 for my living room, connected directly to the Internet via an Ethernet cable. It works great. I bought this Roku Express for my daughter's room, and love the price. It was very easy to set up, connected via WiFi flawlessly, and synced to our other Roku great (meaning it downloaded the same channels I had on the other one). With this one though, make sure you're pointing the remote directly at the receiver or it won't respond. Just a small lag I've noticed when hitting the remote before it does what I want, but no biggie. For the money, it's definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Changes your tv experience
customer_reviews.text: Loveeeee!!!! We have a smart TV but the Samsung apps App Store it's not very large so it wasn't a very good streaming experience having this to our Smart TV completely change the way that we watch TV we cancelled our cable subscriptions and everything if you have someone who you are very close to that has cable all you need is there a logins and then you can watch any app on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Emhaebt

customer_reviews.title: Mostly functional but frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Our old roku was getting really glitchy, and this one is way more reliable. But getting the controller in just the right position is a PITA, especially given that the roku sometimes takes a couple seconds to realize I hit a button, so I'll think it didn't "hear" me, push the button again, and then wind up somewhere random because it thinks I pushed the button twice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Finally I can watch Netflix!! I've only had one issue where it was giving me audio but video was blue. All I had to do was unplug it for 30 sec and it was working fine again. It hasn't happened again since and the connection seems great! Granted, I don't have anything to compare it to because I've never used anything else like it... but I've been binging Netflix shows for about a month now. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: and they're just a little slower then you'd like. It's not bad enough to get rid of
customer_reviews.text: Man, Roku's are odd. You can't turn them off or go to stand by, no youtube access, and they're just a little slower then you'd like. It's not bad enough to get rid of, but not good enough to buy anything else from Roku ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Fay

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: My old Roku 2 stopped working, and I replaced it with this Roku Express. It works great. It loads channels quickly: You tube, Amazon. Picture quality is noticeably better, and the unit is smaller. The included remote is fine, but I use the Roku App for iPhone, and it is WAY better than the included remote. Try it, you’ll like it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Super great buy for what it does!
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far! What a bargain! It was easy to install and gets a great picture. I put the little receiver right on the bottom of my screen with the tape they give you. Excellent reception from many angles.Tons of choices in channels including the ones I watch like Netflix and Amazon and Google Plus. Also it has Pandora which I didn't know. Not that I would know, but I heard that you can get adult channels on Roku. Some of them are even free. It's a little hard to find just Google it. Overall a really great value. I hope it continues to work like it's working now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this for Spectrum (charter cable) service use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened, but during the last month Spectrum (Charter Cable) now is not supporting Roku. After lots of calls to Spectrum with no resolution (their automated voice system said they are working on the problem), I've concluded that the software teams at Spectrum and Roku aren't talking. Unfortunately, I was using Roku as a cable converter for a number of rooms. The Roku product is pretty good other than the lack of support from a major cable company. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: JustKidding

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Got this because the wife wasn't a fan of having to fire up the Xbone and navigate around to get to Netflix, Amazon and Plex. This has an interface that she likes better and it's always ready to go. The remote makes it easy for her too. I like how many services you can load on it. Makes it easy for me to view some of my oddball channels. I wish you had the option to remap the one touch buttons on the remote but that's my only complaint. This is the bargain of a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Negative459Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday worth it. I'd purchase again. Easy set up. Longest part was making an account on roku website. Set up it self besides that was around 2min... No issues with it... My upload speed is under 1MB and Download is 6.6MB with my internet (I know horrible for 50$+ a month) Anyways no buffering or lag issues etc... Happy with my purchase...
customer_reviews.author: CashCarver

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and start up
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my small kids to watch tv without having too many stations at their disposal. Easy set up and start up. They love it and the remote is easy to use. LOVE the simplicity of it and how quickly you can add or remove channels. You will still need access to cable / paid accounts for some full access to channels but great if you choose to just watch what's available. if you want certain Buying another one for my Kitchen tv.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Diva

customer_reviews.title: Great investment if you don't have a smart TV.
customer_reviews.text: It's so great. After the initial investment it saves me money on my cable bill every month. My sons TV isn't a smart TV so he has it to use the cables app and I don't have to pay extra for a box. It would be even better if we could go without cable completely but once I had to pay for internet and all the apps I would need for the shows this is about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Roku for you?
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have purchased (1 for each television). Relatively easy to set up. Plug in the power supply, attach the included HDMI cable to the television and follow the on-screen directions. It still amazes me the number of free shows, movies, documentaries, etc. that are available (thousands). Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great search feature
customer_reviews.text: I love the search feature, so that you can look for a movie/tv show across every app at the same time. I haven't had a single issue with internet connectivity (even though my laptop sometimes has trouble connecting to my home internet). I wanted to use this for spotify as well. However, the spotify app was terrible. They just removed the app from roku devices so that they can improve it. I'm not sure when the app will come back, but hopefully it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does a fantastic job for me
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly good for my purpose, which is to stream Netflix. I don't "do" Hulu or HBOGo or any of the commercial broadcast applets, so YMMV. I love the Netflix button on the remote that takes me straight into the channel. But I took one star off for the clumsy layout of the remote's keys. The remote for the Amazon Fire Stick is much better IMHO. Please see my review of the Amazon Fire Stick to learn why I am not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Rider

customer_reviews.title: The best option
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all the different streaming options this is by far the fastest, cheapest, and most user friendly of the bunch. Would recommend over all competitors. Unlike some it doesn't over heat and freeze up. Very cheaply priced. Offers every channel option imaginable, and there is zero bias about what streaming service you use. Also you don't get blasted with ads or tricked into buying content.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than my previous Roku
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than my previous Roku. My only complaint is that I shouldn't have to buy a new Roku every two or three years. This is the fourth or fifth one I've bought because they keep updating the technology and the app in ways that make the prior versions work less well (or not at all for some channels).
customer_reviews.author: Spelly

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the old Roku, but wanted to get a newer one to work with my TV. I debated about whether this would be as good as the older one. I am not disappointed at all with it. It works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: kphaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: ALTERNATIVE to cable?
customer_reviews.text: Not necessarily unless you don't mind loosing some shows. Without cable subscription, can't get some channels, so lost some favorites. If I really want to see them, I can find them, but I would have to pay extra. Defeats the purpose of getting rid of cable if you are trying to save on cable bill. Lots of Hulu and Netflix originals series. It can make up for some cable loss.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Slater

customer_reviews.title: I love roku
customer_reviews.text: Having a fire stick and a roku I'm obviously a fan of these things. Roku tend to give out after 6 months or so from my experience. So it's nice to have one at such a nice price. I also like the accessibility through roku. With the fire stick they show you all the options for certain movies. But if you're like me you already pay for netflix accessing amazon, so you'd like to only have to look at your from ree movies rather than ones than hat are 5.99+
customer_reviews.author: Megan Christina

customer_reviews.title: Cut The Cable Cord - Roku Is The Way To Go!
customer_reviews.text: Roku has won my heart! I watch my Netflix & Hulu on it. Right now I'm catching Game of Thrones on HBO NOW. I can watch my news daily with the free Reuters app as well. It has been so easy to say goodbye to cable & satellite wit Roku. I have 2 in my home and 1 I bought for my folks who love it (seniors) and how simple it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: Todes Engel

product_meta.title: Roku Express - HD Streaming Player
product_meta.description: Get the Roku streaming player experience at an incredible price. The all new Roku Express―1080p HD streaming made easy. Set up is effortless. Kick back and enjoy access to 450,000+ movies and TV episodes across 4,500+ paid or free channels, including Netflix, Video, Hulu, PBS KIDS, and more. There are no monthly rental fees for owning a Roku Express it’s so affordable, you can make every TV in your home smart. And because it’s from Roku, you’ll get great features like an easy to use remote, simple navigation, and unbiased search across top channels. Watch what you love and spend only what you want.
